title: nbc_project
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

library(DBI)
library(duckdb)
library(readxl)

con <- dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "telemundo.duckdb")


users <- read_excel("data/users.xlsx")
subscriptions <- read_excel("data/subscriptions.xlsx")
streaming_events <- read_excel("data/streaming_events.xlsx")
content <- read_excel("data/content.xlsx")

dbWriteTable(con, "users", users, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "subscriptions", subscriptions, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "streaming_events", streaming_events, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "content", content, overwrite = TRUE)

title: Exploration

SELECT 
  c.language,
  COUNT(*) AS total_views,
  ROUND(SUM(e.minutes_watched), 0) AS total_minutes
FROM streaming_events e
LEFT JOIN content c
  ON e.content_id = c.content_id

Code
WITH user_watch_language AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    c.language,
    SUM(e.minutes_watched) AS total_minutes
  FROM streaming_events e
  LEFT JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

dominant_language AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM (
    SELECT *,
           ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY user_id ORDER BY total_minutes DESC) AS rn
    FROM user_watch_language
  )
  WHERE rn = 1
)

SELECT
  u.preferred_language,
  d.language AS dominant_watch_language,
  COUNT(*) AS users
FROM dominant_language d
JOIN users u
  ON d.user_id = u.user_id
GROUP BY 1,2
ORDER BY users DESC;

title: Insights
text:
Telemundo content is available on Peacock (SVOD).
The objective is to evaluate how Spanish-language content drives:

Acquisition quality (early engagement signals)
Engagement depth and behavior
Retention and churn (subscription durability)

title: Exploration
text:
library(DBI)
library(duckdb)
library(readxl)

con <- dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "telemundo.duckdb")


users <- read_excel("data/users.xlsx")
subscriptions <- read_excel("data/subscriptions.xlsx")
streaming_events <- read_excel("data/streaming_events.xlsx")
content <- read_excel("data/content.xlsx")

dbWriteTable(con, "users", users, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "subscriptions", subscriptions, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "streaming_events", streaming_events, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "content", content, overwrite = TRUE)

title: Exploration
text:
Users are flagged as “Spanish Early” if they watched Spanish-language content within 7 days of signup (minimum 2 minutes watched).

WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT 
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  LEFT JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
)

SELECT
  b.user_id,
  CASE 
    WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 
    ELSE 0 
  END AS spanish_early_flag
FROM base_users b
LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
  ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
 AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date 
                       AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
 AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
 AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
GROUP BY 1
LIMIT 20;


Displaying records 1 - 10


user_id
spanish_early_flag

title: Exploration
text:
Retention is defined as having an active subscription on Day 30 (i.e., subscription started before Day 30 and has not ended).

WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT 
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

retention_30 AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    CASE
      WHEN s.subscription_start <= b.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY
       AND (s.subscription_end IS NULL 
            OR s.subscription_end > b.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY)
      THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END AS retained_30d
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN subscriptions s
    ON b.user_id = s.user_id
)

SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(retained_30d) AS retention_rate_30d
FROM retention_30;


1 records


users
retention_rate_30d




2500
0.9164

title: Exploration
text:
This compares churn rates at 60 days between: - Users with early Spanish exposure - Users without early Spanish exposure

WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT 
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  LEFT JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    b.signup_date,
    CASE 
      WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 
      ELSE 0 
    END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date 
                         AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

churn_60 AS (
  SELECT
    f.user_id,
    f.spanish_early,
    CASE
      WHEN s.subscription_start <= f.signup_date + INTERVAL 60 DAY
       AND (s.subscription_end IS NULL 
            OR s.subscription_end > f.signup_date + INTERVAL 60 DAY)
      THEN 0
      ELSE 1
    END AS churn_60d
  FROM spanish_flag f
  LEFT JOIN subscriptions s
    ON f.user_id = s.user_id
)

SELECT
  spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(churn_60d) AS churn_rate_60d
FROM churn_60
GROUP BY 1;


2 records


spanish_early
users
churn_rate_60d




0
1323
0.3265306


1
1177
0.1580289

title: Insights
text:
library(DBI)
library(duckdb)
library(readxl)

con <- dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "telemundo.duckdb")

# Install + load ICU extension (fixes Quarto render errors on macOS)
dbExecute(con, "INSTALL icu;")

[1] 0

dbExecute(con, "LOAD icu;")

[1] 0



users <- read_excel("data/users.xlsx")
subscriptions <- read_excel("data/subscriptions.xlsx")
streaming_events <- read_excel("data/streaming_events.xlsx")
content <- read_excel("data/content.xlsx")

dbWriteTable(con, "users", users, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "subscriptions", subscriptions, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "streaming_events", streaming_events, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "content", content, overwrite = TRUE)

title: Insights
text:
Cohort Logic
Users who watched Spanish-language content within their first 7 days post-signup:

Exposure window: Day 0–6 after signup_date
Spanish content only
≥ 2 minutes watched

title: Insights
text:
Retention Definition
30-day retention = subscription active on Day 30:

subscription_start <= signup_date + 30 days AND
subscription_end IS NULL OR subscription_end > signup_date + 30 days

title: Insights
text:
SQL (30-day retention for Spanish-early cohort)


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    b.signup_date,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

ret30 AS (
  SELECT
    f.user_id,
    f.spanish_early,
    CASE
      WHEN s.subscription_start <= f.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY
       AND (s.subscription_end IS NULL OR s.subscription_end > f.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY)
      THEN 1 ELSE 0
    END AS retained_30d
  FROM spanish_early_flag f
  LEFT JOIN subscriptions s
    ON s.user_id = f.user_id
)

SELECT
  spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(retained_30d) AS retention_30d
FROM ret30
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;



2 records


spanish_early
users
retention_30d




0
1323
0.8881330


1
1177
0.9481733





Result Interpretation
Early Spanish exposure is associated with higher 30-day retention:

Spanish-early: 94.8%
Non-Spanish-early: 88.8%
+6.0pp retention lift

title: Insights
text:
Key behavioral variables (28-day window)

Active days: number of distinct days watched
Total minutes watched
Titles watched: distinct titles
Genre breadth: distinct genres
Completion rate: % of events completed
Spanish share: % of minutes from Spanish-language content
Recency: days since last watch

title: Insights
text:
Segments (logic + business value)

Superfans

Threshold: Active days >= 12 AND minutes >= 1200 (28d)
Value: highest retention/LTV; prioritize premium tentpoles + exclusives

Habitual Engagers

Threshold: Active days 6–11 OR minutes 600–1199
Value: strong growth lever; improve “continue watching” + personalized rails

Bingers

Threshold: Active days <= 5 AND minutes >= 900
Value: churn risk after series completion; optimize next-best-series sequencing

Spanish-First Loyalists

Threshold: Spanish share >= 0.70 AND active days >= 6
Value: validates Telemundo as retention anchor; invest in Spanish originals/franchises

Browsers / Samplers

Threshold: titles >= 8 AND minutes < 600
Value: acquisition funnel; guided discovery + starter packs improves habit formation

At-Risk / Fading

Threshold: recency >= 14 OR steep decline vs prior period (if available)
Value: immediate intervention; win-back messaging + re-entry UX



WITH events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    e.completed_flag,
    c.title,
    c.genre,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

anchor AS (
  SELECT MAX(watch_date) AS anchor_date
  FROM events_enriched
),

features_28d AS (
  SELECT
    ev.user_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.watch_date) AS active_days_28d,
    SUM(ev.minutes_watched) AS minutes_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.title) AS titles_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.genre) AS genres_28d,
    AVG(CASE WHEN ev.completed_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS completion_rate_28d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ev.language='Spanish' THEN ev.minutes_watched ELSE 0 END) * 1.0
      / NULLIF(SUM(ev.minutes_watched), 0) AS spanish_share_28d,
    (a.anchor_date - MAX(ev.watch_date)) AS recency_days
  FROM events_enriched ev
  CROSS JOIN anchor a
  WHERE ev.watch_date BETWEEN a.anchor_date - INTERVAL 27 DAY AND a.anchor_date
  GROUP BY ev.user_id, a.anchor_date
),

segmented AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    CASE
      WHEN recency_days >= 14 THEN 'At-Risk / Fading'
      WHEN spanish_share_28d >= 0.70 AND active_days_28d >= 6 THEN 'Spanish-First Loyalists'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 12 AND minutes_28d >= 1200 THEN 'Superfans'
      WHEN active_days_28d <= 5 AND minutes_28d >= 900 THEN 'Bingers'
      WHEN titles_28d >= 8 AND minutes_28d < 600 THEN 'Browsers / Samplers'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 6 OR minutes_28d >= 600 THEN 'Habitual Engagers'
      ELSE 'Casual'
    END AS engagement_segment
  FROM features_28d
)

SELECT
  engagement_segment,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(active_days_28d) AS avg_active_days,
  AVG(minutes_28d) AS avg_minutes,
  AVG(spanish_share_28d) AS avg_spanish_share,
  AVG(completion_rate_28d) AS avg_completion_rate,
  AVG(recency_days) AS avg_recency_days
FROM segmented
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY users DESC;

title: Insights
text:
Analytical approach

Define treatment: “Spanish Early” = watched Spanish-language content in first 7 days after signup.
Define outcome: churn_flag (from subscriptions table) and/or churn-by-day-N (e.g., inactive at day 60).
Quantify relationship:

Unadjusted: difference in churn rates between Spanish Early vs not.
Stratified: compare within preferred_language and acquisition_channel to reduce confounding.

Limitations: self-selection, catalog mix, and marketing channel effects.
Next steps: propensity adjustment and A/B test (Spanish-first onboarding merchandising).


WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT
  f.spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(CASE WHEN s.churn_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS churn_rate
FROM spanish_early_flag f
JOIN subscriptions s
  ON f.user_id = s.user_id
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;

  SELECT

    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date,
    preferred_language
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    b.preferred_language,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1,2
)

SELECT
  preferred_language,
  spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(CASE WHEN s.churn_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS churn_rate
FROM spanish_early_flag f
JOIN subscriptions s ON f.user_id = s.user_id
GROUP BY 1,2
ORDER BY 1,2;

title: Insights
text:
Limitations & confounders

Self-selection: users who choose Spanish content early may have higher intent and would retain regardless.
Catalog mix: Spanish titles outnumber English titles, increasing Spanish exposure mechanically.
Acquisition effects: channels may attract different intent users (even if volume is balanced).
Measurement limits: churn_flag is an observed outcome but may not capture pauses, household sharing, or re-subs.
Non-causal inference: observational comparison cannot confirm incrementality.

title: Insights
text:
Recommended next steps

A/B test Spanish-first onboarding

Increase Spanish rails, Telemundo starter packs, and culturally aligned recommendations for new users.

Propensity / matching adjustment

Control for preferred_language, acquisition_channel, and early engagement volume.

Uplift targeting

Identify who gets the most incremental retention benefit from Spanish-first merchandising.

title: Insights
text: This document uses DuckDB inside R/Quarto to demonstrate SQL-first analytical logic.

title: Insights
text:
Joins (Data Model)

User-level attributes
users.user_id is the user grain.
Subscription outcomes
subscriptions.user_id = users.user_id
Used for retention/churn definitions based on subscription activity.
Viewing behavior + content metadata
streaming_events.user_id = users.user_id
streaming_events.content_id = content.content_id

title: Insights
text:
Spanish-language content definition
Spanish-language content is defined using the content dimension:

content.language = 'Spanish'

title: Insights
text:
Minimum meaningful engagement filter
To reduce accidental starts, Spanish exposure requires:

minutes_watched >= 2

(Assumption: <2 minutes likely represents an accidental click or quick exit.)

title: Insights
text:
Retention definition (30-day)
30-day retention is defined as subscription active on Day 30 after signup:

subscription_start <= signup_date + 30 days AND
subscription_end is NULL or subscription_end > signup_date + 30 days


This measures subscription durability (SVOD business outcome), not merely streaming activity.

title: Insights
section: SQL — Construct cohort and compute 30-day retention
text: SQL — Construct cohort and compute 30-day retention

title: Insights
text:
Goal
Segment Hispanic streaming viewers by engagement behavior to inform:

content strategy (what to invest in),
product merchandising (how to surface content),
retention interventions (who to target and when).

title: Insights
text:
Behavioral variables (first 28 days post-signup)
To ensure a consistent and comparable window for all users, features are calculated in the first 28 days after signup:

active_days_28d: distinct watch days (frequency)
minutes_28d: total minutes watched (depth)
titles_28d: distinct titles watched (breadth)
genres_28d: distinct genres watched (diversity)
completion_rate_28d: completion share (content satisfaction proxy)
spanish_share_28d: share of minutes on Spanish content (affinity)

title: Insights
text:
Segment logic + business value

Superfans: high frequency and high depth
Value: highest LTV; prioritize franchise tentpoles and exclusives.
Habitual Engagers: consistent users building habit
Value: growth lever; improve continue-watching and personalized rails.
Bingers: high depth, low frequency
Value: risk after series completion; optimize next-best-series sequencing.
Spanish-First Loyalists: high Spanish share and consistent activity
Value: validates Telemundo as retention anchor; invest in Spanish originals/franchises.
Browsers / Samplers: high breadth, low depth
Value: onboarding/merchandising opportunity; curated starter packs.
No Engagement (0–28d): no viewing in onboarding window
Value: acquisition-quality problem; reactivation messaging and onboarding UX.

title: Insights
section: SQL — Build features (first 28 days post-signup) + assign segments
text:
SQL — Build features (first 28 days post-signup) + assign segments


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    e.completed_flag,
    c.title,
    c.genre,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

features_28d AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.watch_date) AS active_days_28d,
    SUM(ev.minutes_watched) AS minutes_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.title) AS titles_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.genre) AS genres_28d,
    AVG(CASE WHEN ev.completed_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS completion_rate_28d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ev.language='Spanish' THEN ev.minutes_watched ELSE 0 END) * 1.0
      / NULLIF(SUM(ev.minutes_watched), 0) AS spanish_share_28d
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 27 DAY
  GROUP BY 1
),

segmented AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    CASE
      WHEN minutes_28d IS NULL OR minutes_28d = 0 THEN 'No Engagement (0–28d)'
      WHEN spanish_share_28d >= 0.70 AND active_days_28d >= 6 THEN 'Spanish-First Loyalists'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 12 AND minutes_28d >= 1200 THEN 'Superfans'
      WHEN active_days_28d <= 5 AND minutes_28d >= 900 THEN 'Bingers'
      WHEN titles_28d >= 8 AND minutes_28d < 600 THEN 'Browsers / Samplers'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 6 OR minutes_28d >= 600 THEN 'Habitual Engagers'
      ELSE 'Casual'
    END AS engagement_segment
  FROM features_28d
)

SELECT
  engagement_segment,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(active_days_28d) AS avg_active_days,
  AVG(minutes_28d) AS avg_minutes,
  AVG(spanish_share_28d) AS avg_spanish_share,
  AVG(completion_rate_28d) AS avg_completion_rate
FROM segmented
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY users DESC;



4 records

users

avg_minutes
avg_spanish_share
avg_completion_rate

title: Insights
text:
Treatment and outcome

Treatment (Spanish Early): watched Spanish content in first 7 days post-signup (>=2 minutes)
Outcome: subscriptions.churn_flag (observed churn indicator)

title: Insights
text:
Quantify the relationship

Unadjusted churn rates (Spanish Early vs not)


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT
  f.spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(CASE WHEN s.churn_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS churn_rate
FROM spanish_early_flag f
JOIN subscriptions s
  ON f.user_id = s.user_id
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;

title: Insights
text:
Limitations & confounders (important)

Self-selection bias: users who choose Spanish content early may already have higher intent and would retain regardless.
Catalog mix bias: Spanish titles are the majority of the catalog, increasing Spanish exposure mechanically.
Acquisition differences: channels may bring different intent users even if volumes are balanced.
Outcome definition: churn_flag may not reflect pauses, re-subs, or shared-household behavior.
Non-causal inference: observed differences do not confirm incrementality.

title: Insights
text:
Close Connection


Code
dbDisconnect(con, shutdown = TRUE)

title: Exploration
text:
Code
users <- read_excel("data/users.xlsx")
subscriptions <- read_excel("data/subscriptions.xlsx")
streaming_events <- read_excel("data/streaming_events.xlsx")
content <- read_excel("data/content.xlsx")

dbWriteTable(con, "users", users, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "subscriptions", subscriptions, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "streaming_events", streaming_events, overwrite = TRUE)
dbWriteTable(con, "content", content, overwrite = TRUE)

text:
Table Joins

users.user_id is the user-level grain.
subscriptions.user_id = users.user_id
streaming_events.user_id = users.user_id

title: Insights
text:
Spanish Content Definition
Spanish-language content is defined as:
content.language = 'Spanish'
Minimum meaningful exposure:
minutes_watched >= 2
(Assumption: <2 minutes likely accidental playback.)

title: Insights
text:
28-Day Post-Signup Window
All features calculated within:
signup_date → signup_date + 27 days

title: Insights
text:
Behavioral Features

active_days_28d
minutes_28d
titles_28d
genres_28d
completion_rate_28d
spanish_share_28d

title: Insights
text:
SQL: Build Features + Assign Segments


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT user_id, CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    e.completed_flag,
    c.title,
    c.genre,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

features_28d AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.watch_date) AS active_days_28d,
    SUM(ev.minutes_watched) AS minutes_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.title) AS titles_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.genre) AS genres_28d,
    AVG(CASE WHEN ev.completed_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS completion_rate_28d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ev.language='Spanish' THEN ev.minutes_watched ELSE 0 END) * 1.0
      / NULLIF(SUM(ev.minutes_watched), 0) AS spanish_share_28d
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 27 DAY
  GROUP BY 1
),

segmented AS (
  SELECT *,
    CASE
      WHEN minutes_28d IS NULL OR minutes_28d = 0 THEN 'No Engagement (0–28d)'
      WHEN spanish_share_28d >= 0.70 AND active_days_28d >= 6 THEN 'Spanish-First Loyalists'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 12 AND minutes_28d >= 1200 THEN 'Superfans'
      WHEN active_days_28d <= 5 AND minutes_28d >= 900 THEN 'Bingers'
      WHEN titles_28d >= 8 AND minutes_28d < 600 THEN 'Browsers / Samplers'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 6 OR minutes_28d >= 600 THEN 'Habitual Engagers'
      ELSE 'Casual'
    END AS engagement_segment
  FROM features_28d
)

SELECT
  engagement_segment,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(minutes_28d) AS avg_minutes,
  AVG(spanish_share_28d) AS avg_spanish_share
FROM segmented
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY users DESC;

WITH base_users AS (

),

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Success = Durable Subscription Value
Telemundo content should drive:

High early engagement (first 7 days)
Stronger 30-day retention
Lower churn
Cross-language appeal beyond Spanish-preferred users
Repeat viewing across genres (habit formation)

Success is not just viewership — it is subscription durability.

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Early Spanish Engagement Predicts Retention


94.8% vs 88.8% retention
+6pp retention lift for Spanish-early viewers

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
section: Telemundo Content Is a Retention Lever
text:
Telemundo Content Is a Retention Lever
Spanish-language content:

Anchors onboarding behavior
Signals high-intent subscribers
Builds early habit formation
Retains both Spanish- and English-preferred users

Telemundo should be treated as a core retention asset, not just a content vertical.

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
1️⃣ Spanish-First Onboarding Experiment

Increase Spanish rails for new users
Surface Telemundo franchises in first-session UX
Test impact on 30-day retention

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
2️⃣ Personalization Optimization

Build “Spanish-First Loyalist” signal into ranking
Improve post-binge next-best-series sequencing

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
3️⃣ Measure Incrementality

Run A/B test on merchandising
Control for acquisition channel and language preference
Quantify incremental retention lift

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Success = Subscription Durability
Telemundo content should:

Drive early engagement (first 7 days)
Increase 30-day retention
Reduce churn
Build repeat viewing habit
Extend value beyond Spanish-preferred users

Success is not just viewership —
it is measurable impact on retention and lifetime value.

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Action Plan
1️⃣ Run Spanish-first onboarding A/B test
Increase visibility of Telemundo content in first-session UX.
2️⃣ Optimize merchandising for new users
Surface high-retention franchises and starter packs.
3️⃣ Measure incrementality
Quantify retention lift controlling for channel and language.
Objective: Maximize durable subscription value through early Spanish engagement.

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Telemundo Success = Subscription Durability
Telemundo content should:

Drive strong early engagement (first 7 days)
Increase 30-day retention
Reduce churn
Build repeat viewing habit
Extend value beyond Spanish-preferred users

Success is not just viewership —
it is measurable impact on subscriber lifetime value.

vs 88.8% for others

Churn:

20.0%
vs 41.1%

Effect persists across preferred language and acquisition channel.

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
text:
Telemundo Is a Retention Lever
Spanish-language engagement:

Anchors onboarding behavior
Signals high-intent subscribers
Builds early habit formation
Retains both Spanish- and English-preferred users

Telemundo should be treated as a core retention asset, not just a content vertical.

title: Analysis
text:
Telemundo content is available on Peacock (SVOD).
The objective is to evaluate how Spanish-language content drives:

Acquisition quality (early engagement signals)
Engagement depth and behavior
Retention and churn (subscription durability)

title: Analysis
text:
Table Joins

users.user_id is the user-level grain.
subscriptions.user_id = users.user_id
streaming_events.user_id = users.user_id
streaming_events.content_id = content.content_id

title: Analysis
text:
Spanish Content Definition
Spanish-language content is defined as:
content.language = 'Spanish'
Minimum meaningful exposure:
- minutes_watched >= 2
(Assumption: <2 minutes likely accidental playback.)

title: Analysis
text:
Cohort Logic
Users who watched Spanish-language content within their first 7 days post-signup:

Exposure window: Day 0–6 after signup_date
Spanish content only
≥ 2 minutes watched

title: Analysis
text:
Retention Definition
30-day retention = subscription active on Day 30:

subscription_start <= signup_date + 30 days AND
subscription_end IS NULL OR subscription_end > signup_date + 30 days

title: Analysis
text:
SQL (30-day retention for Spanish-early cohort)


Code
-- selecting user and signup date
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT
    user_id,
    CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

-- streaming events left join content by content id
events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    b.signup_date,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1,2
),

ret30 AS (
  SELECT
    f.user_id,
    f.spanish_early,
    CASE
      WHEN s.subscription_start <= f.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY
       AND (s.subscription_end IS NULL OR s.subscription_end > f.signup_date + INTERVAL 30 DAY)
      THEN 1 ELSE 0
    END AS retained_30d
  FROM spanish_early_flag f
  LEFT JOIN subscriptions s
    ON s.user_id = f.user_id
)

SELECT
  spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(retained_30d) AS retention_30d
FROM ret30
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;



2 records


spanish_early
users
retention_30d




0
1323
0.8881330


1
1177
0.9481733





Result Interpretation
Early Spanish exposure is associated with higher 30-day retention:

Spanish-early: 94.8%
Non-Spanish-early: 88.8%
+6.0pp retention lift

title: Analysis
text:
28-Day Post-Signup Window
All features calculated within:
signup_date → signup_date + 27 days

title: Analysis
text:
Behavioral Features

active_days_28d
minutes_28d
titles_28d
genres_28d
completion_rate_28d
spanish_share_28d

title: Analysis
text:
SQL: Build Features + Assign Segments


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT user_id, CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    e.completed_flag,
    c.title,
    c.genre,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c
    ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

features_28d AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.watch_date) AS active_days_28d,
    SUM(ev.minutes_watched) AS minutes_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.title) AS titles_28d,
    COUNT(DISTINCT ev.genre) AS genres_28d,
    AVG(CASE WHEN ev.completed_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS completion_rate_28d,
    SUM(CASE WHEN ev.language='Spanish' THEN ev.minutes_watched ELSE 0 END) * 1.0
      / NULLIF(SUM(ev.minutes_watched), 0) AS spanish_share_28d
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 27 DAY
  GROUP BY 1
),

segmented AS (
  SELECT *,
    CASE
      WHEN minutes_28d IS NULL OR minutes_28d = 0 THEN 'No Engagement (0–28d)'
      WHEN spanish_share_28d >= 0.70 AND active_days_28d >= 6 THEN 'Spanish-First Loyalists'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 12 AND minutes_28d >= 1200 THEN 'Superfans'
      WHEN active_days_28d <= 5 AND minutes_28d >= 900 THEN 'Bingers'
      WHEN titles_28d >= 8 AND minutes_28d < 600 THEN 'Browsers / Samplers'
      WHEN active_days_28d >= 6 OR minutes_28d >= 600 THEN 'Habitual Engagers'
      ELSE 'Casual'
    END AS engagement_segment
  FROM features_28d
)

SELECT
  engagement_segment,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(minutes_28d) AS avg_minutes,
  AVG(spanish_share_28d) AS avg_spanish_share
FROM segmented
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY users DESC;



4 records


engagement_segment
users
avg_minutes
avg_spanish_share




Casual
2084
141.7524
0.7962273


Spanish-First Loyalists
238
326.7185
0.9170555


No Engagement (0–28d)
152
NA
NA


Habitual Engagers
26
330.8846
0.6044571





Business Value
Segmentation enables:

Franchise prioritization (Superfans)
Next-best-series sequencing (Bingers)
Spanish-first investment validation (Spanish-First Loyalists)
Onboarding optimization (No Engagement)

title: Analysis
text:
Treatment
Watched Spanish content in first 7 days (≥2 minutes).

title: Analysis
text:
Outcome
subscriptions.churn_flag

title: Analysis
text:
SQL: Unadjusted Churn Comparison


Code
WITH base_users AS (
  SELECT user_id, CAST(signup_date AS DATE) AS signup_date
  FROM users
),

events_enriched AS (
  SELECT
    e.user_id,
    CAST(e.watch_start AS DATE) AS watch_date,
    e.minutes_watched,
    c.language
  FROM streaming_events e
  JOIN content c ON e.content_id = c.content_id
),

spanish_early_flag AS (
  SELECT
    b.user_id,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(ev.user_id) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS spanish_early
  FROM base_users b
  LEFT JOIN events_enriched ev
    ON ev.user_id = b.user_id
   AND ev.watch_date BETWEEN b.signup_date AND b.signup_date + INTERVAL 6 DAY
   AND ev.language = 'Spanish'
   AND ev.minutes_watched >= 2
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT
  spanish_early,
  COUNT(*) AS users,
  AVG(CASE WHEN s.churn_flag THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS churn_rate
FROM spanish_early_flag f
JOIN subscriptions s
  ON f.user_id = s.user_id
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1;



2 records


spanish_early
users
churn_rate

1
1177
0.1996602





Observed Outcome

Non-Spanish-early churn: 41.1%
Spanish-early churn: 20.0%
−21.1pp absolute reduction
~51% relative reduction

text:

title: Telemundo on Peacock — Executive Summary
section: What We Should Prioritize Next Quarter
text:
What We Should Prioritize Next Quarter
Action Plan

Increase visibility of Telemundo content in first-session UX.
